meanings.definition: To make Catholic in character or doctrine.
meanings.sent1: She is catholicizing her beliefs by attending church regularly.
meanings.sent2: The priest is catholicizing the teachings for the new members.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried catholicizing the dog by sitting on its favorite spot.
meanings.sent4: His love for Italian food is catholicizing his taste buds.
meanings.sent5: The colorful stained glass windows catholicize the church interior.

meanings.definition: To bring under Catholic influence or control.
meanings.sent1: The missionaries are catholicizing the remote village.
meanings.sent2: The king was catholicized by the persuasive words of the bishop.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully catholicized their friend into joining their game.
meanings.sent4: The music from the cathedral catholicized the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of incense catholicizes the air during the service.
